comments.author: josh@joshtriplett.org
comments.text:
Currently, the HTML mail composer offers a formatting toolbar with various useful formatting options, but the plain-text mail composer offers no such formatting toolbar.  Many of the options in the formatting toolbar have sensible meanings in plain-text emails, and in fact Thunderbird uses the appropriate conversions when converting HTML mails to text/plain.  For example:

- Bulleted lists
- Numbered lists (with automatic numbering)
- Preformatted text without word-wrapping (see bug 639261, a subset of this request which this change would fix)

I'd like to request that the formatting toolbar remain on when composing plain-text emails, and that it include the various formatting options which have useful plain-text equivalents.

Some other mail clients offer such formatting options when composing plain-text emails.  For instance, Evolution allows the formatting options mentioned above, as well as indenting/outdenting text.
